title: Add Dining Hawaii Blog Section

requirements.text: Create a dedicated Dining Hawaii blog page/section featuring local restaurants, Hawaiian food culture, and culinary experiences. Include a blog-style layout with featured dining posts, each containing a title, description, cuisine type tag, location (island), and an image. Cover topics such as plate lunch culture, shave ice, poke bowls, luau feasts, and fine dining options across the islands.
acceptanceCriteria: A Dining Hawaii blog page or section is accessible from the main Hawaii guide navigation
The blog displays at least 6 dining posts/cards covering different culinary experiences and islands
Each dining card shows a title, short description, cuisine/food type tag, and island location
Content covers a variety of Hawaii food culture topics (e.g., poke, plate lunch, shave ice, luau, local restaurants)
Smooth scroll navigation or a nav link connects to the dining section from the main page

requirements.text: Apply the existing warm tropical visual theme (golden yellows, coral, ocean teal, sandy beige, tropical typography) consistently to the new Dining Hawaii blog section, using card-based layouts that match the style of the existing destinations and activities sections.
acceptanceCriteria: The dining blog section uses the same tropical color palette defined in tailwind.config.js (ocean, golden, coral, sand tokens)
Card layouts in the dining section visually match the style of DestinationCard and ActivityCard components
Typography is consistent with the rest of the Hawaii guide page

requirements.text: Use generated static images (stored in frontend/public/assets/generated) as visuals for the dining blog cards and any hero/banner area for the dining section.
acceptanceCriteria: Each dining card displays a relevant food/restaurant image loaded from frontend/public/assets/generated
Images are properly sized and styled within the card layout

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui/
Preserve all existing Hawaii guide sections (hero, destinations, activities, travel tips, footer)
Maintain the existing tropical color system defined in tailwind.config.js and index.css
nonGoals: No backend data persistence for blog posts â€” all content is static
No user-generated content, comments, or authentication for the blog
No removal or restructuring of existing Hawaii guide page sections
